Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the potential threat of Iran having an "industrial-size military nuclear capability ready to go" once the restrictions of the Iran nuclear deal expire.
Understate: The claim may understate the limitations and monitoring provisions that will extend beyond the 15-year mark of the agreement, which would prevent Iran from developing nuclear weapons.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that Iran will have an "industrial-size military nuclear capability ready to go" after the restrictions expire.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Iran will immediately pursue a military nuclear program once the restrictions expire, without considering other factors or motivations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for Iran's actions or intentions, such as the possibility of continued adherence to nonproliferation agreements.
